- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

In Linux, the script is not called from the Prompt function. Exactly the same function in Windows works without problems. Is there any limitation? This was working good an year ago. The script is a Christmas tree on which toys change their colors at each iteration of the Prompt function.
```
# simplified

function Prompt {
" > "
hny
}
```
![ss-20211216152253](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78153320/146371395-85de3923-a5b6-4aaa-9abf-83d7e246d071.png)


### Expected behavior

```console
Script has to be called. Like in Windows.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
But it has not.
```


### Error details

```console
No errors at all.
```
